description:
Works fantastic i was able to find the zip that was impossible to locate Geez a File locator worth having in your arsenal!

Hi5
save me hours finding game save files
If it's not working for you try adding your home folder to the database
what's the point if it can't even access external drives?

I can't respond directly to reviews so I'll use this review to address some issues: If accessing external drives doesn't work then you're probably using the Snap version. As described in the app description, this is due to the sandboxing enforced by Snap. It can be fixed by running the following command: sudo snap connect fsearch:removable-media
I've added this information to the store page to avoid further confusion. However it's advised to use the native or Flapak version instead for wider file system access.

I have no idea what it means when the application does not work at all. I've never had any bug report of that type. In general, please report issues through the supported channels where I can respond to them and get a chance to fix/resolve them: https://github.com/cboxdoerfer/fsearch#readme

I'm coming from Windows, where VOIDtools "Everything" is a fantastic tool, which I've grown extremely accustomed to. FSearch is the closest equivalent I was able to find - it launches fast, it gives me results instantaneously, and I love that. 

I have two suggestions for improvement, if the developer would consider them meaningful:
1. When resizing the default fields in the program (e.g., "Name", "Path", "Extension"...), they should stay resized even after an app restart. Right now they go to their default size, which hides the long file and path names I have.

2. Due to work, I am using OneDrive, which I have mounted automatically with Rclone Browser. I don't know if FSearch considers this an external drive (?), but I get no results from my mounted OneDrive (which is fully operational in my File Manager).

Other than that, this is a fantastic app, so major props for making it available for us all. Cheers!
summary: Fantastic app, even for a Windows convert who has a few suggestions

description: I needed to find a random file on my steam deck, rather than search around for its full path just tossed it into Fsearch and found it. No complaints for a basic everything search.
summary: Worked exactly as Everything for me

description:
This would be of much more use, if the functionally of the program would work without having to fight root privildges .. right out of the box. All the other search softwares that come bundled with Ubuntu seem to have that problem fixed, like searching in external hard drives formatted in NTFS.

in GNOME file manager search, you never get the dredded "permission denied" when accessing those files cached-mounted to /"user"/media/
Indexes files on the SSD and any mounted drive. Fast, easy to use, does not crash, makes finding files a better experience.
summary: Great app, I use it hundreds of times per day

description: I agree with other reviews. This app opens but has no functionality
